parse.title: List of international presidential trips made by Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa

text.*:
His Excellency
Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa
President of Portugal
Incumbent
Assumed office
9 March 2016 (2016-03-09)
Preceded by Aníbal Cavaco Silva
Personal details
Residence Belém Palace
Signature
Website www.presidencia.pt

This is a list of international presidential trips made by Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, the current President of Portugal.

Contents

  • 1 2016
  • 2 2018
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

2016[edit]

Country Locations Date Details
  Vatican City

 Spain

Vatican City,

Madrid

17 March Visit to the Vatican City to meet Pope Francis and Cardinal Secretary of State Pietro Parolin and then to Spain to meet King Felipe VI.[1][2]
 Mozambique Maputo 3–6 May Four days trip.[3][4][5]
 Morocco Casablanca 28 June About eight-hour visit to meet King Mohammed VI.[6][7][8]
 Brazil Rio de Janeiro,

São Paulo,

Recife

3–8 August Trip for the opening ceremony of the 2016 Summer Olympics.[9]
  Switzerland Geneva,

Bern

17–18 October [10]
 Cuba Havana 26–27 October 26 October: Visit to Old Havana;[11] opening of a Portuguese-language library named after Eça de Queirós;[12] closing speech at the Portugal–Cuba Business Forum;[13] meeting with Fidel Castro;[14][15] meeting and dinner with Raúl Castro.[16][17]

27 October: Visit to the Cohiba cigar factory;[18] conference on "Portugal and Latin America" at the University of Havana;[19] reception of the Portuguese Cuban community at the Portuguese embassy;[20] visit to the "Cuban Art Factory".[21]

 United Kingdom London 16–17 November 16 November: Meetings with City businessmen, bankers, and investors. Lunch offered by recently elected Lord Mayor Andrew Parmley. Meeting with Prime Minister Theresa May at 10 Downing Street. Event with members of the local Anglo-Portuguese community at the Portuguese embassy.[22]

17 November: Visit to artist Paula Rego's workshop. Reception hosted by Queen Elizabeth II.[22]

2018[edit]

Country Locations Date Details
 São Tomé and Príncipe São Tomé

Fernão Dias Neves Santo António

20-22 February [23]
 Greece Athens

Thebes

12-14 March Visit to Greece to meet Prime-Minister Alexis Tsipras and the President of The Hellenic Parliament Nikos Voutsis. President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa receives an Honorary Degree from the University of Athens. Dinner with President Prokopis Pavlopoulos. Visit to International Organization for Migration's refugee camp in Thebes.[24]

See also[edit]

  • List of international presidential trips made by Mário Soares
  • List of international presidential trips made by Aníbal Cavaco Silva
